title: Supporting Evidence for Solar System Formation

previous.title: The Formation of the Solar System

next.title: The History of the Solar System

content: We can also find evidence to support the solar nebula theory by studying the motions of objects within the Solar System. To validate this evidence, view a histogram that show inclinations of all four groups of solar system objects and look for overall patterns in the way objects orbit the Sun. (Remember, any inclination greater than 90 degrees indicates an object that is orbiting backwards.)

question.title: Question #1
question.labelPost: of Solar System objects orbit in the same direction around the Sun.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: If the direction of an objectâ€™s orbit was random, there would be an equal chance that any object would travel around the Sun in either direction. Do the orbits you observe appear to be the result of random chance? If not, what might explain the direction of their orbital motions?
